instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00164  phantom SYS_Onewire
threads.message:
I have a tricky little board I would like some opinions on.

The green light on the charger is intermittent.   Some times when you plug it in some times it works  some times it does not.   "most of the time not"
I watch it on the scope and when not working the voltage never comes up and there is no data.   When working totally normal including the after chatter.

Here is the fun part.   I have replaced the SMC / DC-IN and Ribbon are my testers so they are definitely good.
I diode checked and ohmed out the SYS_Onewire and compared it to a working LB and it is exactly the same.  I have also resoldered J9500 "which was perfect without water damage" and verified it is solid.

LB will function properly off a power supply driven cord that does not need the SYS_Onewire signal to turn on power.
I am kind of thinking the only thing left is a damaged line inside the board and I would have to run a jumper under the SMC but I am like "no... way...." !


Ideas?

threads.title: 820-00164  phantom SYS_Onewire
threads.message: Is PP3V42_G3H 3.42V and PPBUS_G3H 8.56V when it is not working? Does it turn on properly if DC-in FFC is unplugged?

threads.title: 820-00164  phantom SYS_Onewire
threads.message:
Check direct continuity between MLB and and LIO board for SYS_ONEWIRE, SMC_BC_ACOK and 3V42_G3H lines.
SMC_BC_ACOK is always high?
